_comment: Issuer-specific denomination form overrides. Key = canonical denomination (from denomination-aliases.json). Value = map of Numista issuer code -> { singular, plural } override forms. Only exception cases are listed; issuers not listed here fall through to the denomination-aliases.json default. Keys starting with _ are ignored by the normalizer. WHY THIS FILE EXISTS: denomination-aliases.json answers 'what are the spelling variants of this denomination?' (normalization concern). This file answers 'what exact singular/plural form does Numista use for this denomination in a specific country?' (search concern). Keeping them separate means aliases.json stays a pure spelling-variant table while this file is a living search-form table: adding a new country-specific override requires one JSON entry here, no code changes.
_centesimo_note: Default: centesimi (Italian). Italian-sphere issuers (italie, italy_kingdom, saint-marin, vatican) use the default and are NOT listed here. Spanish/Latin American countries use centesimo/centesimos (with accent on Numista: centesimo/centesimos).
_centimo_note: Default: centimos (no accent). Spanish-speaking countries use centimo/centimos with accent on Numista. Add others as discovered.
_krone_note: Default: krone/kroner (Danish/Norwegian). Swedish uses krona/kronor. Czech/Slovak/Czechoslovak use koruna/korun — completely different from krone/kroner. Faroese and Icelandic use krona/kronur but accent stripping means krone is close enough for Numista search.
_lira_note: Default: lira/lire (Italian). Turkish uses lira as both singular and plural. Israeli historical lira (1948-1980) uses lirot as plural.
_dinar_note: Default: dinar/dinars. Arab-world dinars use dinars correctly. Yugoslav/Serbian coins inscribe dinara (Serbian plural).
_real_note: Default: real/reais (Brazilian Portuguese). Spanish colonial coins use reales. Covers the main issuers — add others as needed.
